key_insight: Applying Nesterov-style momentum to ray-direction search (ARS-OPT) substantially accelerates convergence for hard-label black-box attacks, cutting the number of queries needed to find minimum-ℓ2 adversarial perturbations.
problem_solved: Reduces the prohibitive query complexity and slow convergence of ray-search methods under the hard-label (top-1 only) black-box threat model, making practical evaluation and attack generation more efficient.
method: Recast hard-label attack as an optimization over ray directions that minimize the ℓ2 distance to the adversarial region.
Introduce ARS-OPT, a momentum-based algorithm inspired by Nesterov’s Accelerated Gradient to update ray directions with lookahead momentum and maintain query efficiency.
Provide theoretical convergence-rate improvements and empirical validation showing fewer queries and faster attainment of near-optimal perturbations versus baselines.
impact: Lowers the query budget for reliable hard-label attacks, enabling more practical robustness evaluation and faster black-box testing; the momentum-based recipe can generalize to other gradient-free search problems.

paper_title: Improving the Convergence Rate of Ray Search Optimization for Query-Efficient Hard-Label Attacks
paper_authors: Xinjie Xu, Shuyu Cheng, Dongwei Xu, Qi Xuan, Chen Ma
